body: @kortschak They're certainly very related.  But my impression is #8994 is about the rules for how you can safely convert unsafe.Pointer to uintptr *and back*, whereas this issue seems to be more about which arithmetic laws still hold after converting unsafe.Pointer to uintptr.  E.g., the `overlap`/`offset` functions being discussed above don't care about convert uintptr back to unsafe.Pointer.
